meanings.definition: Occulters: a person who practices occult arts or magic
meanings.sent1: The occulters gathered in the forest to perform their mysterious rituals.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the power of occulters to influence events through supernatural means.
meanings.sent3: The children dressed up as occulters for Halloween, casting spells on their friends for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother was like an occulter, weaving spells of protection around their home.
meanings.sent5: The old book was said to contain secrets known only to the ancient occulters.

meanings.definition: Occulters: to hide or conceal something
meanings.sent1: He tried to occulter his true feelings, but his eyes gave him away.
meanings.sent2: The spy used a clever disguise to occulter his identity from the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The magician used sleight of hand to occulter the disappearance of the coin.
meanings.sent4: The dense fog began to occulter the view of the approaching ship.
meanings.sent5: She used a password to occulter the private files on her computer.

meanings.definition: Occulters: a device used to block or obscure light
meanings.sent1: The photographer used an occulter to control the amount of light entering the camera.
meanings.sent2: The telescope was equipped with an occulter to reduce glare from the stars.
meanings.sent3: The classroom had special blinds with occulters to dim the sunlight during presentations.
meanings.sent4: The ancient temple had intricate designs incorporating occulters to create patterns of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The stage lighting technician adjusted the occulter to focus the spotlight on the lead actor.
